name: The Hotel at Terminal City Club

reviews.text: Interesting how different experiences can be! I just stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and was extremely disappointed after reading other reviews.
reviews.title: Overrated for the price

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in an executive suite with beautiful harbor views, and it was a great base location for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Excellent One-Night Stay

reviews.text: This is an older hotel and as expected the décor and room amenities reflect same. I.E. the furniture is quality but aged, there was water damage on the walls near the shower, there are no vending machine areas, etc.
reviews.title: Fitness club adds incredible value

reviews.text: The biggest problem was the staff. I found them to be unfriendly and unhelpful. On arriving, the bell-hop didn’t even offer to take our bags up to the room! There was seldom anyone at the front door, and the concierge seemed to be at her desk only a few hours a day. When attempting to ask the front-desk staff for any information (I.E. locations, directions or other recommendations) the responses tended to be terse and vague. When calling down to ask a question about a local theater the response was “Oh, I wouldn’t no about that. Look it up in the phone book.” Basically, you are treated as if you should already know where everything is. I’ve never stayed at a hotel that didn’t even have local maps available to assist you with exploring the area.
reviews.title: Vancouver's best kept secret
If your NOT looking for the best value in Vancouver.........
reviews.text: The workout center is nice and the staff there was far more helpful. The exercise equipment is fairly standard, but the locker rooms, pool and sauna/steam rooms are exceptional.

Our one night stay at Terminal City Club was quite pleasant mainly due to an 'eager to please' bell hop. His youth and energy were refreshing and charming. It was apparently clear that our happiness was of utmost importance to him. The next day he loaded our luggage up on his cart and walked us to the Canada Cruise Terminal making our registration and boarding our cruise seamless. (We would have never found our way alone.) The Club Restraunt was cold, stuffy and definitely lacking in charm next to the service we received at the hotel. Our hats off to this young man ... bravo for a job well done!
reviews.title: Ready for European Elegance?

likes.liked: — The service from the bell hop.
likes.disliked: — The Club Resturaunt was pius, stuffy and HIGHLY over rated!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here prior to a cruise. The hotel is centrally located and within easy walking distance to most places. The staff was helpful and the hotel very nice. Our first room had a terrible view of the side of a building. They quickly changed us to a second room which was a suite with a view of the water. We ate at the pub downstairs and the food was good. A typical pub type atmosphere. Unfortunately, we didnt have an opportunity to use the amenities, but they looked like the pictures.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: We also stayed at the Pan Pacific and this is a much better hotel all around.
reviews.title: A view to die for

likes.liked: — harbour views and convenience of location
likes.disliked: — There were a few housekeeping glitches -- minor

reviews.text: The Terminal City is an old established Vancouver club, which has been reborn with the addition of a luxury tower incorporating up-scale condos, several floors of luxury hotel suites, and extensive recreational and spa facilities. It is a fabulous property -- just across the street from Canada Place and the major cruise port facilities. If you get a room with a harbour view, you'll be able to look down on moored cruise ships, and see float planes coming and going... and all of this with the skyline of North Vancouver and the Canadian Rockies in the background.
reviews.title: I'll stay here next time

reviews.text: We chose a junior suite facing the harbour. With a wall of glass, the view was exceptional. Otherwise, the room was fairly typical of what one would expect in this price range. The restaurants are very good, but the street level features a wide variety of excellent restaurants, so there is no need to feel confined to what is offered on site.
reviews.title: My letter of thanks.

likes.liked: — Proximity to Business Centre in Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please see my pictures to see what the rooms look like. This hotel is within walking distance to the cruise ship terminal and shopping areas. During our stay there was an underground fire in the city and most places lost their electricity. This hotel has its own generator so it was a great place to be. Other people were trying to get rooms there and we were glad to not have to worry. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The rooms were clean and nice.
reviews.title: Great location, near cruise ship terminals

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night and thought it was a great hotel for a quiet night. They have free internet and room service which was great for a business traveller.
reviews.title: Excellent for business travel

reviews.text: Extremely quiet location and nice views of the city.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in great location
Nice stay at The Terminal City Club Tower Hotel
reviews.text: The parking is a bit confusing as there is not a place to park your car and check in. You have to park underground and then go up and check in which was a bit backwards. As well, when I checked out the front desk didn't ask me how my stay was which I thought was unusual.
However, I would choose this hotel again because it didn't seem overrun with tourists etc and ideal for business travellers.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.disliked: — no cons. everything was very good.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Terninal city hotel was a perfect way to end the cruise. After being in a small room the our kids we splurged for the largest suite. The room was gorgeous with first class amenities and comfortable beds. The views (it was a corner) offered floor to ceiling windows of the mountains and the sea.

reviews.title: Shhhh...a great secret means no-one else knows!
reviews.text: The club was fun although it closed too early. The pool is the largest and the hottub a great way to unwind. It was walking distance from everything and we had an ethnic dinner at Hons (very traditional cafeteria style Asian cuisine in a fun atmosphere) and went to Gastown to a funky new-age pizza and american cuisine on the water called Incendio...a 5! (great artwork too!)

reviews.title: Good "stay", but....one problem later
reviews.text: Keep it down! The Terminal City Club is one of my favorite hotels in the West Coast, and I'd like to ensure it doesn't get booked up whenever I'm up there.

reviews.title: best kept secret
reviews.text: The in-hotel dining room is excellent, the rooms are spacious and well-appointed. The water views are breathtaking, and the location of the hotel is convenient to all of downtown and Stanley Park; you truly can't find a better location.

reviews.title: Great for the family!!!
reviews.text: I also find the staff there to be quintisentially Canadian: gracious, willing to help with any problems, and service oriented. The quiet nature of the Club also makes for a good staff-guest ratio.

description: The Hotel at Terminal City Club offers the perfect location for business travellers. As a hotel guest, you have access to Vancouver's premier private business club, Terminal City Club. This allows you to entertain your clients, enjoy excellent food and presentation as well as private reserve wines. Our fitness centre is befitting a high-end Club. We have high quality cardio and strength equipment and offer a 25m ozonated swimming pool, as well as squash courts. THE HOTEL at Terminal City Club is one block from the Vancouver Convention Centre and two blocks from the Canada Line and Cruise Ship Terminal.NOTICE - The Hotel at Terminal City Club will have a change of management as of January 1st, 2014. The hotel will then be 'Auberge Vancouver'.As of January 1st, 2014, there will be limited access for non-members to Terminal City Club (fitness centre only).
